summary: This document is a chain of emails from June-July 2019 among FBI and DOJ personnel coordinating a conference call to discuss victim interviews in the Jeffrey Epstein case. It shows internal planning for a case briefing requested by the ADIC (Assistant Director in Charge) and scheduling conflicts with other meetings.

persons.name: Connell
persons.context: Identified as a supervisor of forensic interviewers who would be on the call to discuss Epstein victim interviews.

connections.description: Both are involved in the planning and coordination of the Epstein victim interview conference call, indicating they work within related law enforcement units.

events.title: Scheduled Epstein victim interviews call
events.description: A conference call was set up for 2:00 PM Eastern Time to discuss victim interviews in the Epstein case, but it appears to have been rescheduled.

events.title: ADIC-requested case brief
events.description: The Assistant Director in Charge (ADIC) requested a case briefing on Monday at 3:30 PM, creating a hard stop for other meetings.

events.title: Meeting with M and team
events.description: A 2:30 PM meeting was scheduled with M and his team on a wider variety of subjects, separate from the victim interview discussion.

locations: 863 (likely an office or room number referenced for a call/meeting)
FBI NY Criminal Division Violent Crimes Task Force
keyFacts: The FBI's Victim Services Division, specifically the Child Victim Services Unit and Child/Adolescent Forensic Interviewers (CAFIs), were actively involved in planning interviews for Epstein victims in June-July 2019.
An Assistant Director in Charge (ADIC) requested a case briefing on July 1, 2019, indicating high-level oversight of the Epstein investigation.
Coordination issues arose between a dedicated victim interview call and a broader meeting with M's team, showing multiple parallel investigative tracks.
The communication shows the use of unclassified conference calls for sensitive case discussions among law enforcement personnel.
